subject: Medicine
title: The Three-Pound Universe
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Three-Pound Universe usable.

hook.text: Your brain weighs about three pounds but uses 20% of your body's energy. It's the hungriest organ you own.

buildup.text: The brain contains roughly 86 billion neurons, each connected to thousands of others.

discovery.text: These connections form networks that produce every thought, memory, emotion, and movement you experience.

twist.text: Despite mapping the entire human genome, we've barely begun to map the brain's wiring diagram.

climax.text: The brain is the most complex known structure in the universeâ€”and it's sitting inside your skull right now.

punchline.text: Three pounds of tissue running all of you.

quiz.question: How much of the body's energy does the brain use?
